name: NewYorker
text: A lawsuit filed by Coney Island Prep, a charter school in Brooklyn, alleges that the government’s incompetent response to the pandemic is not just destructive—it’s also illegal. https://t.co/5ES7YPoNki

name: NewYorker
text: The drive from Tucson to Las Vegas takes approximately eight hours when travelling in a vehicle whose top speed is 45 miles per hour. In Desert Bus, an unreleased video game from 1995, players must complete that journey in real time. https://t.co/jcdYHaxLpU

name: NewYorker
text:
The New York Botanical Garden is home to some hundred thousand species of trees, ferns, shrubs, wildflowers, and grasses, all indigenous to the Northeast.
https://t.co/E3Rs7jGZ1I

name: NewYorker
text: “Most stolen-valor cases don’t involve master criminals but, rather, average men who want to be treated as if they were extraordinary.” @rachmonroe on military imposters and the people who track them down. https://t.co/wlvo3OaZzT

name: NewYorker
text: What makes “The Queen’s Gambit” so satisfying comes in large measure from Anya Taylor-Joy's character: a charming, elegant weirdo who delivers her lines with a cool, wintergreen snap, @rachsyme writes. https://t.co/fWO34D2tLd
